storyInfo: Two Chernobog survivors leave Ursus for the wastelands, seeking out the legendary 'Rusthammers.' However, in the wastelands, things are rarely that simple.

attributes.content: Careful. Walk slowly.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: I'm alright... no need to prop me up.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Save your strength. We're still not clear until we're over that mountain.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: How far are we now... from Ursus?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Not that far. We aren't deep in the barrens yet... not deep enough.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Let me just breathe for a moment...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Go ahead. I'll wait.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: ...Huff...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: What's past the mountain, to the northeast?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Kazimierz people's land, I think.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: But we're not going that way.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: This is the first time I've left Ursus.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: You'll get used to it.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: There's nothing left for us in Ursus.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Phew... this place looks good enough.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: It's almost night. Let's set up camp here.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Um... how much do we have left in rations?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: We've gone through more than half the haul from the warehouse. Plus what we traded for from the wandering settlement, we still have about four day's worth... not a whole lot.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Watch our bags. I'll look for some firewood.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: This place is... so quiet.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: That's not a bad thing. We should be wary of anyone passing by, though.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Call it a stroke of good luck that we came through without any trouble.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Bandit groups and outlaws, packs of wild beasts...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Most would say the barrens are a fatally dangerous place to be.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Can we really find our way to these 'Rusthammer' people?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: There's no reason the vagabonds would trick us. There'd be no sense in tricking us.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Rusthammer's people are operating nearby, that much plenty know.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Will they accept us?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: We can't be sure, but we have to try.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Long before, in the village... the soldiers all said the 'Rusthammers' were a vicious, barbarous lot, thugs who killed for pleasure on the wastes.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: They all said that, and afterwards there were people in the team who told of them too...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Rumors aren't sure to be truth. Have you forgotten how those bastard noblemen spoke of us?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: 'Insatiable, ruthless Reunion bandits.'
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: All the old patriarchs of Ursus need to do is make a bag of rumors up, and they can turn anything they don't like into maneating monsters for the commoners.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: It's a customary trick of theirs. This definitely isn't like that, as far as I can see.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Have you met them before?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: I have. It was even while I was serving.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: That year was the year they said the borderland armies went into Kazimierz territory, plundering villages.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Ah... I heard about that from someone in my own village.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: The captain mentioned it too. They all died after, apparently?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: The captain told you all that?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: They were Ursus regulars. A whole army platoon, armed to the teeth, bringing full sets of combat equipment past the border. There's no hope of completely fooling us about what was happening.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: The looting was just an excuse by the brass to shift the blame. Maybe the soldiers really did want to stir up a battle, you know.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Sadly, things didn't go how they wanted. I don't know what took place in Kazimierz's hilled forests... but not a single one of them came back. A total annihilation, more or less.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: As for the truth behind why they crossed the border... they're all dead, and who cares anymore.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: But their death isn't solely down to the Kazimierz people... that I know for sure.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: So what happened?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: It was the fourth day the soldiers had crossed into Kazimierz... a sentinel reported that a great group of wastelanders entered Ursus' own borders.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Wastelanders?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Back then, I was stationed right at the border garrison's resupply station, and when the sentinel announced invaders, nobody in the barracks took it seriously.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Though you don't often see a whole crowd of barrenland vagabonds on their last hopes, it's not new, either. Especially not at the Ursus border.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: They sent out a little squad, ready to intercept the poor saps and boost manpower a little in the jurisdiction's mines. Nothing too strange compared to their usual business.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Let me guess. That squad didn't come back?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: The next morning, a guard with his face coated in blood scrambled into our camp. It wasn't just the squad who got wiped out. Three neighboring checkpoints had completely fallen too, and only he made it back out alive.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: The station officer at that time wasn't as stupid as now. He determined it was Kazimierz soldiers disguising as barrenland wanderers and springing attacks on checkpoints, so he immediately reported a need for reinforcements to the higher-ups.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: It took until then for us to realize, our Originium communicators had lost all signals from allies within range, and we were sitting fowlbeasts on our own. After that, that night...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: After the sun set, a sound of metal beating traveled all throughout the valley, fearsome and ear-piercing, like the primitive drums of war.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: And then there were people. So many people... more than a hundred... maybe more than a thousand, carrying countless rough works of weaponry, shouting rallying cries we had no hope of understanding, charging madly into our camp.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: They looked like humans, yet you couldn't sense the 'human' part of them. I thought they'd gone crazy, because even if the comrades by their sides were blown away by artillery, the pace of their assault didn't slow one bit.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: I'd say that's the most terrifying attack I've ever experienced. Forget Reunion's countless battles afterwards, none of them could compare to that evening of insanity.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: They only retreated once first light finally came over the valley.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Innumerous corpses piled all around the camp, bloodstains and marks from Originium Arts bombardment everywhere... the whole day through, the air was filled with a smell of rust so thick you could vomit.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: ...That's just too excessive.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Why attack the Ursus Army with no regard for the cost? What was their goal?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: That's the crucial bit.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: After a few days, a backup unit finally made it. It was only then we learned that two Infected mines nearby had been totally plundered, they'd set everyone in the mines free, and burnt down five whole military supply warehouses in the area.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: They hacked up the officers and mine overseers they caught, and tore every Ursus flag and landmark they found to shreds...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Rusthammer washed off the traces of Ursus, and left behind not a single mark in the ruins.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: What was most important was, the unlucky lot who gallivanted into Kazimierz land had practically lost all of their rear reinforcements. Once the Ursus Army had reacted, it was already too late.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Even now, I still can't comprehend their lunatic conduct.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: But 'wasteland scum who slaughter for pleasure' wouldn't raid the Ursus Army in order to free the poor people in the mines.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: They're not normal thugs, I'm certain of that.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: ...That story really is...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Hard to believe, right.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: I still have no way to tell... if it would be a correct choice to join them.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Even someone of Mr. Patriot's caliber got...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Don't think about it. Let's just go to sleep.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: There'll always be a way.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Maybe...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: We're here...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: This is where... we were looking for...?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: 'Straight north from the second peak, on top of a massive, upright boulder.'
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: I didn't imagine it would actually be here.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: A rust-speckled iron hammer is stuck upside-down in a boulder on a peak, the black rag tied to the handle like a flag fluttering wild in the wind.
'If you wish to join us, then search for the rusthammer in the rent-apart rock.'
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: This group likes a bit of dramatic delivery, huh.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: This isn't dramatics, this is a symbol.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: If you want to live on the barrens, you must be like this hammer.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: You don't need to be sharp, but you do need to be tenacious.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: You don't resemble... 'ordinary passers-by.'
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: I recognize the symbol on your clothes.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: 'Reunion.'
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Speak. Tell us why you sought us.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: You... you don't look like you're Infected.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: I thought...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: We-We want to join the Rusthammers!
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Join?
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Weak, timid, fearful, helpless...
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: You're scared of everything upon the barrens, shivering, like livestock awaiting slaughter.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Here. Pick these up.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Wh... What are these? A shovel and pick... and a beast trap?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: What do you mean by this?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Why give these tools to us?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: You want to join the Rusthammers? Then prove yourselves.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Prove you belong to the wastes. Prove you aren't livestock incapable of surviving beyond their pen.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: We are warriors. We are the wasteland's conquerors. We look after each other. We share everything of ours.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: But we will not care for unbearably weak trash.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: See that gorge over there? It's a kind place to be, the kindest all around here.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: In the gorge is everything you need.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Survive for a month here.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: If even that's beyond you, then head straight back where you came as soon as you can.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Survive? For a month? In a place like this?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: You've got to be fricking kidding me.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Surviving on the barrenlands with just these?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: If you just wanted to watch us die, why make it so complicated? Wouldn't it be so much easier to do it right here?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: You're just going to laugh at us as we die on the barrens? Is this some sick hobby of yours?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Or is persecuting the Infected one of your joys, too?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: And I thought you weren't like the other bandits... you bunch of...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: ...Hahahaha.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Infected? Infected??
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Hahahaha...
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Persecute the Infected? Hahahahahahahaha...
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Boone!
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Come on over, take a look at this moron.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: While the grand Rusthammer man laughs wildly, a hunched-over man appears from behind the crag, the Originium crystals terrifyingly ugly on his skin. The man's forceful gaze pierces through his untamed hair, sizing up the person before him.
Look, look, look, Boone.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Do you see? These are your 'Infected comrades.'
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Bullshit. I have no comrades this weak.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member Boone

attributes.content: Y-You're Reunion too...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Here, nobody cares whether you're Infected or not. Nobody cares what kind of special rank you have.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Nobody fricking cares.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Man, woman, old, young, Sarkaz...
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Reunion? Fallen noble? As long as you embrace the wilderness, cut away from the poison blood of civilization, we are all equal.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Just one month, was it...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Illa?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: That's right. If you can hold out for one month, that'll show you're part of the wastes, that you've broken free of civilization's fetters.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Once the time comes, you'll be a part of the barrenlands, and our Rusthammer brothers and sisters will welcome you.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Alright... it's a deal.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Not a bad attitude. I have great faith in you.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: I wish you good luck, young lady.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Illa, are you serious?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: We... don't have much choice, do we?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: No. We still have rations. We can go back, go back to that vagrant village, think of another way.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Don't mess with me! We never had that much in supplies! You haven't eaten for two days, I've noticed that!
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: We're comrades in arms, aren't we? Comrades have to look after each other, right?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: These Rusthammers... they're able to survive here... perhaps we can do the same.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: ...I suppose.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Lend a hand. We'll find a place to set up camp first.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Fifteen days later
...Why isn't it moving...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Shh! Don't make a sound. It took the bait.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: And I feel it's about to run.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Calmly... wait for it... wait...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: It moved!
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Just a bit more... just a bit more...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: We caught it! We caught it! Hahahaha!
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Oh, wonderful! Wonderful!
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Hahahaha! Alright.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Illa, pass me the knife.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Here it is.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: There really were burdenbeasts here. This is my first time seeing one wild.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: With all this meat, we can smoke it, dry it in the cave, and it'll keep for a while...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: At least for the next long while, we won't have to eat dried sandworm.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: I'm not sure if that wandering village is still around.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: What made you think of it suddenly?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Even if we smoked this meat, we wouldn't finish it. Maybe we could trade it with those wasteland wanderers for some supplies.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Like a couple seeds or something...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Has anything happened with those mossoats?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Listen to you. Have you never planted anything before in your life?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: ...I haven't. I was born in the city.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Heheh. My little city friend, food is hardly that easy to grow. You'll want to properly learn.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Who's a little friend... You're barely older than me.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Whatever, I'm dropping it.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Those wanderers barely ever stop in one place, but there should be a few settlements below the mountain to the east. If we have the chance, we can go take a look.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Come over here, let's take all this back in.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Thirteen, fourteen, fifteen...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Still half a month to go...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: I hope those Rusthammers mean what they say.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: But I feel like now, it doesn't matter whether we have them or not.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: I've been feeling more and more like we can survive.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: I've actually wondered the whole time... Why would there be a cave like this in a gorge? It doesn't seem naturally formed, either...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: I'm betting this was an ancient mine.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: A mine? In this completely desolate area? Was it the Kazimierz?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Can't say it's either Kazimierz or Ursus for sure.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Can't even be sure if it's a country we're familiar with.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Before, when I was in the army, someone told me all these ancient stories.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: They said that centuries ago, millennia ago, Ursus wasn't yet Ursus, Kazimierz wasn't yet Kazimierz, and so many countries were emerging across the land, growing, becoming strong.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: And in the end, once again because of war or Catastrophe or some other reason, they were destroyed, and fell to pieces.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Catastrophes repeatedly swept the earth, any trace of these countries' existence cleaned up along with them. Everything we can find was left underground, just like this mine, for example. They say loads of other places all have ancient remnants like this.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: So that means...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: These places weren't always barrenlands, but were once towns and cities where people lived?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Maybe.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: If... If we keep living in here, and get more and more people like us, we might just be able to set up a small town or something...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: This gorge goes south to north. It could hold plenty of people.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: And then I'd be Mayor Illa! And you'd be Deputy Mayor Gareth!
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Alright, enough daydreaming. Help me hang up the meat.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Alright~
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Twenty-nine days later
Gareth! Gareth!
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: What is it... so early...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Quick, come look, the mossoats!
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Are... Are these buds?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: They are!
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Great! Great! Oh, that's amazing!
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: So we can plant grains here after all!
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: I'm guessing the burdenbeast bone powder played a part.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Alright, let me see... what was the most important thing, again?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Water!
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: We won't have enough relying on that mountain creek. We'll need to think of some other way.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: But... there's no other springs anywhere nearby.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Our only option's to head to the foot of the mountain east and try our luck. There's trees there, which means there's a water source.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: But that's too far away. Would we be carrying water every day?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: It's far, but it's worth it.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: If these mossoats can grow properly, then it'll all be worth it!
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Let's sort our things out, and we'll head to the woods to look.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: It seemed to be pretty close... I didn't think it was so far...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: We'll need to think of something later on, figure out an even bigger container.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: It's not realistic to carry it just with water pouches.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Hold on... what is this?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Are these footprints? There's other people nearby.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Footprints? What footprints?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: ...No... these...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: These are army bootprints!
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: I'd recognize these sole markings anywhere. These are Ursus army boots.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: What... What are Ursus soldiers doing here?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: What do we do...
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: ...Let's hurry back. Get our things in order.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: We need to leave this place. These marks... they haven't gone too far, and there's at least twenty of them by these footprints.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Wait! We have other options, too.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: If we don't light a fire... they won't be sure to notice the cave in the gorge.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: They'll find us sooner or later! Even if we don't light fires, what's the use of hiding in the cave day after day? We don't even know if they'll leave or not!
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: They've come to get me. I knew the colonel wouldn't let me off so easily...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: No! I'm not leaving!
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Illa!
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Where would we even run to? I'm already sick of running! I joined Reunion so I could live with some semblance of self-respect at all!
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: This past month... life this past month has been tough, undoubtedly, but what does it matter that it's tough?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: There's no taxmen, no nobles! There's prey in the forest, mossoats in the ground, all of my own!
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: This whole month, I've lived like a person! And not like some beast just dragging out its life!
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Illa, calm down a little, listen to me.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: As long as we're still alive, we can always find some place that belongs to us, and if we die, we'll have nothing at all!
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Don't tell me, every time we run... every time we run, we have to abandon everything that's already ours? Why should I let those wretches destroy my life again and again!?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: First, my village's people... my little sister... then Sharla... the captain.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: I'm not going anywhere today.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: If today I die, then I'm dying in this gorge. Everything in here was our painstaking work. This is my new home.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: I'm not going anywhere!
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: ...Illa.
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Stay here, Gareth. Let's fight them.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: We're warriors of Reunion. We're not cowards.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: You're right!
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: These goddamned sons of bitches!
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Those bastard nobles, and Colonel Lomono... damn them all... damn them all to hell!
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Good! Excellent!
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: You finally resemble the spitting image.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: ...It's you!
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Why were you... Were you nearby the whole time?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: You were to survive on the barrens for a month. All I did was check in daily to see if you were still good and going.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Forget that for now. There's Ursus nearby...
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: Don't get too wound up. All I'm hearing is a few paltry little annoyances.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Then... have we qualified?
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Qualified?
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: You're Rusthammer already, sister.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: And you. Though you came just short of your willpower crumbling, I'm very happy to see you chose the right path.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: Compromise and escape are never-ending. Remember that.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: Welcome, brother.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: Now, as well as that, a group of idiotic prey are heading straight for the beast trap. You shouldn't miss this.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Member

attributes.content: Prey? What prey?
attributes.name: Gareth

attributes.content: They're here.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: I knew there'd be people in this gorge.
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: You really have given me the runabout, you know, Corporal Gareth.
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: You shameful deserter. You even dared mingle in just to steal food supplies from the army warehouse.
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: Did you truly believe you could trample on the Ursus Army's dignity and then so vainly flee?
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: Colonel Lomono's very angry. Particularly angry. Only lopping off your head can quell his fury now.
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: Time to pay for your crimes, you Infected scum...
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: Black-clothed Ursus brutes... twenty-four of them.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: Heh, I see you're quite merry with these flesh-tearing savages! Surely you don't think a couple of barrenland natives can save your lowly lives?
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: Now kneel and off yourself. I can promise you a death in one piece.
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: Snipers, ready...
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: The masked Rusthammer warrior uses the weapon in his clutch to beat the ground.
One sound.
Two sounds.
Three.
In the next second, the entire ravine echoes with an ear-piercing pounding, chaotic yet resounding clear.
Battle-cries, roars, together with a chilled gust that blows through the ravine, like the great land itself has let out a primeval scream.
At this instant, Gareth sees it.
Upon the cliffs and ledges of the gorge's two sides stand wild warriors, packed together.
Their clothing ragged, adorned in worn metal forged into crude armor.
Their postures twisted, grasping simple but fearsomely shaped weapons.
C... Captain! H...
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: How... How many is this???
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: H-How could this be?! What about the sentinel? Where did the sentinel go?!
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: If you're looking for your 'sentinel,' then right here.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: These... helmets... weapons, how could you possibly...
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: My brother and sister, welcome to the wastelands. This is your first hunt since joining the Rusthammers.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: I'm glad of the chance to join you in battle.
attributes.name: Illa

attributes.content: Battle?
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: Sister, we never 'battle.'
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: As more and more Rusthammer warriors show themselves, the Ursus soldiers are stunned, not daring to make a move. When they begin to speak, all the twenty-four can do is stand there silently.

Theythe so-called 'countries' and 'civilizations'display, from the root, their evil. Their colossal nomadic cities, their ugly steel creations, their metal fetters and cells cast from malice, are the sinister proof of their sin.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: They have stolen everything. They have plundered this world's minerals, seized its water and land, and taken it all for their own.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: They claim that only faith in 'civilization' can bring salvation, that everything not bound by their shackles has been stamped by a barbarous seal. They fear the truth, and we will return the truth to the land.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: They use force to make you afraid, they use civilization to make you feeble, they give you no choice but to rely on their baselessly invented 'order,' no choice but to trap yourself in the cage.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: And so they enslave you who by all rights ought to be free, and so they swallow you!
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: This world ought to belong to everyone. Everyone should, like you and I and anyone else, take a place in these wastelands with their own two hands! The wasteland will eliminate the weak, but when traced to the source, just who was it that made the people of the world weak?
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: You must become their nightmares, become their calamity, become the force that destroys them.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: Who can shackle and manacle a hurricane, an earthquake? And who can imprison a thunderclap, a lightning bolt within a cage?!
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: We never battle! We destroy!
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: We pulverize the cage, we destroy the fetters, we plunder back that which was stolen, and those willing to abandon weakness may all become Rusthammer brothers and sisters.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: Destroy! Destroy! Destroy! Destroy! Destroy!
The chaotic yet resounding metal pounding echoes through the whole gorge.
They shout, strike the earth with the handles of their weapons, the collision of metal and rock as if thunder rolling through the dark.
Destroy! Destroy! Destroy! Destroy! Destroy!
Have no fear! They're just a bunch of lunatics!
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: Get into formation! P... Prepare for battle!
attributes.name: Ursus Soldier

attributes.content: They tremble. They fear us. We destroy. We hunt.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: Cast away the fetters of civilization. We will never be weak again.
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: Catastrophes sweep the wastelands...
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warrior

attributes.content: Rusthammers smash the world!
attributes.name: Rusthammer Warriors
